name: Eleftheria Arvanitaki
description: '''Eleftheria Arvanitaki''' ([[Greek alphabet|Greek]]: Ελευθερία Αρβανιτάκη) (born 17 October 1957 in [[Piraeus]]) is a [[Greeks|Greek]] folk singer. She originates from the island of [[Icaria]]. Arvanitaki has worked with musicians such as [[Cesária Évora]], [[Arto Tunçboyacıyan]] and [[Ara Dinkjian]]. On 14 March 2010 [[Alpha TV]] ranked her the sixth top-certified female artist in the nation's phonographic era (since 1960).
